summary: An email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York requesting a Spanish interpreter for proffers related to the Epstein death investigation, scheduled for September 5, 2019. The request notes the interpreter has previously interpreted for the subject.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: The email is sent from or on behalf of an AUSA requesting interpreter services for the Epstein death investigation proffers.

events.title: Scheduled Proffers for Epstein Death Investigation
events.description: Proffers (informal interviews or statements) are scheduled to be conducted, requiring a Spanish interpreter, as part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein's death as of August 2019.
Proffers (cooperative interviews) were scheduled for September 5, 2019, as part of this investigation.
A Spanish interpreter was requested for these proffers, indicating at least one witness or subject required Spanish language interpretation.
The interpreter was specifically requested because they had interpreted for the subject in the past, suggesting prior involvement in the case.
